newsitem.title: REPUBLIC OF IRELAND: New bill would outlaw discrimination in employment.
newsitem.headline: New bill would outlaw discrimination in employment.

text.p: Ireland's equality minister Mervyn Taylor introduced a bill to parliament on Tuesday that would outlaw discrimination in employment on the grounds of gender, marital status, sexual orientation, religion, age, disability, race or membership of the travelling community.
"The scope of the bill is comprehensive and deals with all employment areas, from training to access to employment and to employment conditions generally," Taylor said.
He pointed out that discrimination in the labour market is widespread.

"Take discrimination on the grounds of age. A scan of the daily newspapers provides ample evidence of outright discrimination. Labour force surveys show that older workers, once unemployed, are likely to remain out of work, longer than younger people," he said.
